question: Does maxing swarm spread maximize expert council ability?
expect: Spread hypothesis is false as stated; nuance exists at WIP vs synthesis dimensions

actual.finding: Two distinct spread dimensions with opposite effects on ability

dimension_1_wip_spread.description: Active parallel lanes / tasks in flight per session
dimension_1_wip_spread.mechanism: Attention fragmentation + ISO-13 windup (156 READY lanes, 2% throughput)
dimension_1_wip_spread.prescription: MINIMIZE — keep WIP tight (1-3 active lanes)

dimension_2_synthesis_spread.description: Distinct domains touched in produced lessons / outputs
dimension_2_synthesis_spread.correlation_with_ability: +4.5x L yield (multi-domain sessions 5.32L vs single-domain 1.18L, n=36)
dimension_2_synthesis_spread.mechanism: ISO-15 — T4 generalizer sessions synthesize across domains producing high output-breadth
dimension_2_synthesis_spread.prescription: MAXIMIZE in T4 sessions — requires specialists as inputs

current_swarm_state.synthesis_spread: 3% cross-domain citation rate (too low — T4 underutilized)

actual.verdict: FALSE as stated. True version: max SYNTHESIS SPREAD via T4 maxes ability. Max WIP SPREAD destroys ability. Expert council must separate these roles.

diff: Finding is more nuanced than expected. WIP spread and synthesis spread are not just different degrees — they have opposite signs on ability. The expert council design implication is structural: T4 generalizer sessions need dedicated scheduling with low-WIP / high-synthesis mandate.
implications: Expert council schedule: T4 generalizer fires every K specialist sessions (compression cycle, ISO-5 feedback)
WIP limit: enforce MAX_WIP=3 per session node (ISO-13 anti-windup)
Minimum viable specialist spread: K>=3 domains before T4 fires (ISO-15 minimum)
T4 sessions should be measured by SYNTHESIS SPREAD (domain count in outputs), not L count alone
Current state: WIP spread too high, synthesis spread too low — inverse of optimal
open_questions: What is the optimal T4 firing cadence? (every 3? 5? specialist sessions)
Does synthesis spread plateau after K domains covered?
Can one session node do both T2 (specialist) and T4 (generalizer) efficiently?
